targetString: Homoni ya binadamu inayosababisha shinikizo la damu inayobadilisha enzaimu 2 (ACE2) inafahamika kuwa kipokezi cha SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: WIV1 iliyozolewa kwenye sampuli ya kinyesi ya popo ilionyeshwa kutumia popo, ngawa na human ACE2 kama kitambuzi cha kuingia kwenye seli.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: Cha kushangaza, seramu kutoka wagonjwa wanaopona wa SARS ziliweza kuangamiza WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Kufikia sasa, WIV1 inawakilisha kizazi cha karibu cha SARS-CoV kwenye popo, wakiwa na 95% za msururu wa nucleotide unaofanana.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa mfanano mkubwa kati ya virusi hivi, inaaminika kwa jumla kwamba WIV1 si virusi vizazi vya kati vya SARS-CoV na popo sio wabebaji wa kati wanaohifadhi SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: Uchanganuzi wa kifilogenetiki unaweka pamoja MERS-CoV kwenye kikundi sawa na bat CoV-HKU4 na bat CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: Bat CoV-HKU4 na MERS-CoV hutumia vitambuzi sawa vya mbebaji, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), kwa ajili ya kuingia kwa virusi.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Misururu ya RNA- tegemezi ya RNA polymerase ya MERS-CoV inakaribia kufanana na iliyo ndani ya bat beta-CoV vilivyotambuliwa barani Ulaya na Afrika.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Kufikia sasa, hakuna virusi vya MERS-COV vinavyoweza kupatikana ndani ya popo wa porini.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV na jamii yake ya karibu zaidi ya bat CoV-HKU25 vina mfanano wa 87% wa msururu wa nucleotide.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa hivyo, popo huenda wasiwe wabebaji wa kati wahifadhi wa MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, tafiti zilizofanywa Mashariki ya Kati zimeonyesha kwamba ngamia mrefu zaidi zina antibodi mahususi ya kusawazisha MERS-CoV, sawa na ngamia wenye chimbuko lao Mashariki ya Kati walio katika nchi nyingi za Afrika.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Live MERS-CoV inayofanana na virusi hivyo vinavyopatikana kwa binadamu vilitolewa kwa sampuli za puani kutoka kwa ngamia warefu zaidi, na kuashiria zaidi kwamba ngamia wanaweza kutumika kama wabebaji wahifadhi wa virusi vya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: Pia ni muhimu kudokeza kwamba dalili za wastani lakini utoaji wa virusi kwa wingi kwa ujumla ulionekana kwa ngamia waliambukizwa na MERS-CoV kwa ajili ya majaribio.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: Ni dhahiri kwamba, ngamia hutoa virusi sio tu kupitia njia ya pumu lakini pia kupitia kinyesi, ambayo pia ni njia kuu ya kutoa virusi kutoka kwa popo.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Hata hivyo, maswali bado hayajajibiwa kwa vile visa vingi vya watu waliothibitishwa kuwa na MERS hawana historia ya kugusana na ngamia kabla ya kuanza kwa dalili, na kuashiria pakubwa maambukizi ya binadamu hadi kwa binadamu au njia zisizojulikana za usambazaji zinazohusisha aina za viumbe ambao hawajatambuliwa wanaobeba MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 vina 96.2% za nucleotide zinazofanana na za bat CoV RaTG13 vilivyotolewa kwa popo wa Rhinolophus affinis.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Ilivyo katika visa vya SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, tofauti za msururu kati ya SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 ni kubwa zaidi hivyo haviwezi vikawekewa uhusiano wa kiuzazi.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Hiyo ni kusema kwamba, popo huenda sio mbebaji wa karibu mhifadhi wa SARS-CoV-2 isipokuwa CoV vinavyokaribia kufanana vya popo vipatikane siku zijazo.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Inaweza kuchukuliwa kwamba mnyama mbebaji wa kati wa SARS-CoV-2 anapaswa kuwa miongoni mwa aina ya wanyama wanaouzwa na kuuawa katika Soko la Huanan Seafood Wholesale, ambapo visa vingi vya kwanza vya COVID-19 vilihusishwa, ikiashiria uwezekano wa tukio la usambazaji kutoka kwa mnyama hadi kwa binadamu.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Tafiti nyingi za hivi majuzi zenye misingi kwa misururu ya kimetagenomiki zimeashiria kwamba kikundi cha wanyama wadogo walio hatarini kupotea wanaojulikana kama kakakuona (Manis javanica) wanaweza kubeba virusi vya jadi vya beta-CoV vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Jenomeu hizi mpya za CoV kutoka kwa kakakuona zina asilimia 85-92% ya msururu wa homolojia ya nyukliotaidi sawa na virusi vya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Hata hivyo, pia vinahusiana kwa karibu na RaTG13 kwa takriban 90% ya utambulisho katika ngazi ya mfululizo wa nucleotide.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Vinapangwa katika jamii mbili ndogo za virusi vinavyofanana na SARS-CoV-2 katika mchoro wa kifilogenetiki, moja yao ikiwa inashiriki kikoa sawa kipokezi cha kunata (RBD) sawa na SARS-CoV-2, kilicho na 97.4% ya mfululizo wa utambuzi wa amino acid.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Katika ulinganisho wa kindakindaki, RBD za virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 ni tofauti kabisa, angalau kiwango kikubwa cha upana wa msururu wa genome ya homojia.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Utafiti wa awali kwenye kakakuona waliokuwa wagonjwa pia uliripoti kugunduliwa kwa virusi katika sampuli za figo ambavyo vilitokea kuwa na uhusiano na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Utafiti ulitumia mbinu tofauti za ukusanyaji na kushughulikia kikuli ili kuzalisha upande wa msururu wa jenomu ulio na 86.3% ya urefu kamili wa jenomu.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Hatuwezi kufungia nje uwezekano kwamba kakakuona ni mmoja wa wanyama wabebaji wa kati wa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Hata hivyo, kwa sasa hakuna ushahidi wa kuunga mkono chimbuko la SARS-CoV-2 moja kwa moja kutoka kwa kakakuona kutokana na tofauti za msururu kati ya beta-CoV vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV-2 vilivyopatikana kwa kakakuona.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Pia, umbali uliopo katika ya SARS-COV-2 na RaTG13 ni mfupi hata zaidi kuliko ule uliopo kati ya beta-CoV zinazohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV-2 vilivyopatikana kwa kakakuona.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: Njia ya ukuaji wa SARS-CoV-2 ndani ya popo, kakakuona na wanyama wengine bado inasalia kuundwa.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Ingawa mfanano wa juu zaidi wa msururu umepatikana kwenye RBD kati ya beta-CoV vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV-2 vilivyopatikana kwa kakakuona, SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 vina mfanano wa juu wa msururu wa jenomu.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Inakisiwa pakubwa kwamba kiwango cha juu cha mfanano kati ya RBD za beta-CoV vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 vinavyopatikana ndani ya kakakuona na SARS-CoV-2 unasababisha na ukuaji wa kimkusanyiko unaoletwa kwa msingi wa uteuzi.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Pendekezo kinzani linaunga mkono uunganishaji tena wa beta-CoV vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 vilivyopatikana kwa kakakuona na RaTG13 ndani ya aina ya tatu ya wanyama wa porini.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: Kama kani inayoendesha ukuaji, uunganishaji tena umeenea miongoni mwa virusi vya beta-CoV.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Uamuzi bado haujafikiwa kuhusu chimbuko la karibu la SARS-CoV-2 kutoka kwa wanyama.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Kando na uwezekano wa HCoV kusababisha magonjwa, chimbuko la HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 na HCoV-HKU1 kutoka kwa wanyama pia limefanyiwa utafiti.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Ushahidi wa kifilogenetiki unaonyesha kwamba HCoV-NL63 na HCoV-229E huenda vilitokana na bat-CoV, huku virusi mama vya HCoV-OC43 na HCoV-HKU1 vimepatikana ndani ya jamii ya panya.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Imeripotiwa kwamba virusi vya bat CoV vinavyoitwa ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) vilivyogunduliwa Marekani Kaskazini, popo wa rangi tatu alionyesha uhusiano wa karibu na HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, HCoV-229E ilihusiana kigenetiki na bat CoV nyingine, vinavyoitwa Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, vilivyogunduliwa nchini Ghana, huku mnyama mdogo jamii ya ngamia pia wakishukiwa kuwa wabebaji wake wa kati.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Kwa uwazi, muktasari kuhusu ujuzi wa sasa kuhusu chimbuko la HCoV vinavyojulikana kutoka kwa wanyama umewekwa katika Picha ya 1 na Jedwali la 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: Uchanganuzi wa kifilojenetiki umetoa ushahidi wa matukio ya usambazaji wa HCoV baina ya aina za wanyama katika historia.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Wakati HCoV-OC43 vilisambaa baina ya wanyama na kuambukiza binadamu vikitoka kwa wanyama karibu 1890, janga la maambukizi ya pumu lilirekodiwa.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: Historia ya usambazaji baina ya wanyama wa HCoV-229E si bayana.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: Bat alpha-CoV vinavyohusiana kwa karibu na HCoV-229E vimepatikana.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Kati yao kuna alpha-CoV vilivyopatikana kwa alpaca-mnyama jamii ya ngamia.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Mikondo kadhaa ya ushahidi unaounga mkono usambazaji wa virusi kutoka kwa popo hadi kwa binadamu moja kwa moja.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Kwanza, binadamu wala sio alpacas huenda walikuwa na mgusano na popo katika mazingira ya kiekolojia.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Badala yake, binadamu wanatagusana kwa karibu na wanyama wa alpaca.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Pili, bat alpha-CoVs vinavyohusiana na HCoV-229E ni tofauti na havina uwezo wa kusababisha ugonjwa ndani ya popo, ilhali alpha-CoV vilivyopatikana kwa alpaca vilisababisha mkurupuko wa ugonjwa wa pumu kwa wanyama walioambukizwa.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: Mwisho kabisa, alpha-CoV vilivyopatikana kwa alpaca havijapatikana ndani ya wanyama wa porini.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Hivyo, uwezekano wa alpacas kupata alpha-CoV vinavyohusiana na HCoV-229E kutoka kwa binadamu. hauwezi kufungiwa nje.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Hakika, popo ndio chanzo cha moja kwa moja cha virusi vinavyosababisha ugonjwa kwa binadamu ikiwa ni pamoja na virusi vya rabis, virusi vya Ebola, virusi vya Nipah na virusi vya Hendra.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Kwa hivyo si ajabu kwamba popo wana uwezo wa kusambaza HCoV-229E moja kwa moja kwa binadamu.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Vinginevyo, ingawa virusi vya alpha-CoV vinatumika kama kikoa cha jeni cha HCoV-229E, alpacas na ngamia warefu zaidi huenda wanatumika kama wabebabji wa kati wa virusi wanaosambaza virusi kwa binadamu, hasa ilivyo katika hali ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: Virusi vya MERS-CoV vinatumika kama mfano bora wa usambazaji baina ya wanyama kutoka kwa popo hadi kwa ngamia warefu na kutoka kwa ngamia warefu hadi kwa binadamu.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Chimbuko la ukuaji la MERS-CoV kutoka kwa popo linafahamika katika utambuzi wake wa kwanza na pia limepigwa jeki na matokeo yaliyofuatia.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ni wazi kwa kwamba popo hutoa kikoa cha aina ya virusi kwa ajili ya mabadilishano baina ya wanyama ya vipande vya kijenetiki na usambazaji baina ya wanyama.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Uwezo wa kuishi kwa muda mrefu, makazi yenye wanyama wengi, miingiliano ya karibu ya kijamii na uwezo thabiti wa kurika ni hali zinazomfanya popo kuwa 'mnyama anayeweza kueneza virusi'.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, MERS-CoV vimewekwa ndani ya ngamia warefu kwa muda wa miongo.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Vilizoeleka ndani ya ngamia hawa ambao wamegeuka kutoka kwa wabebaji wa kati wa virusi hadi kuwa wabebaji thabiti na asilia wahifadhi wa virusi.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: MERS-CoV husababisha ugonjwa wa wastani na hudumisha kiwango cha chini cha kubadilika ikilinganishwa miongoni mwa wanyama hawa.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Usambazaji wake kwa binadamu kwa ajili na binadamu wanasalia wabebaji wa mwisho wa MERS-CoV wasioambukizana kwa sababu usambazaji wake hauwezi kudumu.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Kwa ulinganisho, jukumu la ngamia katika usambazaji wa MERS-CoV, jukumu la kakakuona, ikiwa kuna lolote, katika usambazaji wa SARS-CoV-2 ni tofauti.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Hususan, beta-CoV vinavyopatikana kwa kakakuona vina uwezo mkubwa wa kusababisha magonjwa ndani ya kakakuona.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Wanaweza kuwa ndio wanabeba virusi vya SARS-CoV-2-vinavyohusiana na beta-CoVs, sawa na ngawa katika hali ya SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Uwezekano kadhaa wa usambazaji wa SARS-CoV-2 baina ya viumbe kutoka kwa wanyama hadi kwa binadamu lazima liweze kukubalika au kukataliwa katika tafiti za siku zijazo.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kwanza, popo wanaweza kuwa wabebaji wahifadhi wa virusi vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 vinavyokaribia kufanana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Binadamu wanaweza kushiriki mazingira ya kiekolojia na popo kupitia vichinjioni au maeneo ya uchimbaji makaa ya mawe.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Pili, kakakuona wanaweza kuwa mojawapo ya wabebaji wa kati wanaosambaza virusi ambao wamepewa virusi vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2 kwa mara ya kwanza.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Binadamu wanapata virusi kupitia kuchinja na kula nyama ya wanyama wa porini.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kuna uwezekano kwamba wanyama wengi ikiwa ni pamoja na wanyama wa nyumbani wanaweza kupata SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa wanyama wa nyumbani na wa porini kwa ajili ya antibodi unastahiki.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Tatu, ilivyotajwa hapa juu, kujumuishwa tena na kuzoeleka kwa SARS-CoV-2 huenda kulifanyika katika kiumbe cha tatu ambacho kimegusana na popo na kakakuona.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Utafutaji wa chimbuko la SARS-CoV-2 kutoka kwa wanyama bado unaendelea.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Kando na aina tofauti ya wanyama wabebaji, vigezo vitatu vikuu kwenye upande wa virusi ni muhimu katika kuwezesha vizuizi dhidi ya kusambazwa kwa CoV kwa viumbe.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Kwanza kabisa, viwango vyao vya juu vya kubadilika katika uzalishaji wa RNA.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Vikilinganisha na virusi vingine vya RNA moja, viwango vya kubadilika kwa CoV vinaweza kuzingatiwa kuwa “wastani” au “juu” huku kiwango cha wastani cha ubadilishanaji kikiwa ~10-4 kwa mwaka kwa kila eneo 2, kwa kutegemea awamu ya kuzoeleka kwa CoV kwenye mbebaji wake mpya.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoVs vina exoribonuclease vya udurusu ambazo zikifutwa kutasababisha kuongezeka kwa uwezo wa kubadilika, kupunguza athari au hata uwezo wa kuishi.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Jambo la kupendeza ni kuwa, dawa ya nucleotide analogue Remdesivir inafahamika kudidimisha uzalishaji wa CoV kupitia uzuiaji wa exoribonuclease na RNA polymerase inayotegemea RNA.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Remdesivir ni mojawapo ya chanjo iliyo na uwezo mkubwa dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2 iliyofanyiwa majaribio ya kimatibabu.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Licha ya hayo, viwango vya kubadilika kwa CoV ni takriban mara milioni zaidi ya vile vya wabebaji wao.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Pia, viwango vya kubadilika mara nyingi viko juu wakati CoV havijazoeleka kwenye mbebaji.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Vikilinganishwa na SARS-CoV vilivyo na viwango vya juu vya kubadilika, viwango vya kubadilika kwa SARS-CoV-2 ni bayana kuwa viko chini hali inayoashiria uwezekano wa juu zaidi wa kuzoeleka kwa binadamu.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Inaweza kuchukuliwa kwamba, tayari vimezoeleka kwa mbebaji mwingine wa karibu na binadamu.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Pamoja na SARS-CoV-2, hii pia inatumika kwa MERS-CoV, ambayo vimezoeleka vyema ndani ya ngamia warefu zaidi.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Kinadharia, hakuna uwezekano kwamba mabadiliko ya kijenetiki yanaweza kufanya chanjo na dawa za kupambana na virusi dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2 zisiwe faafu haraka.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Pili, jenomu kubwa ya RNA kwenye CoVs ina uwezo zaidi wa kubadilika umbo katika urekebishaji wa jenomu kwa ajili ya mabadiliko na uunganishaji tena, hivyo kuongeza uwezekano wa ukuaji pamoja baina ya viumbe, jambo ambalo ni la manufaa kwa kuibuka kwa CoV mpya hali zikiwa zinafaa.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Haya yanaungwa mkono na fremu maalum wazi zilizo tele na utendakazi wa protini zilizosimbwa kuelekea mwisho wa 3 wa jenomu.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Tatu, CoV bila mpangilio na mara kwa mara hubadili kiolezo wakati wa uzalishaji wa RNA kupitia utaratibu maalum wa "copy-choice".

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Ndani ya mbebaji virusi anayetumika kama chombo cha kufanyia mchanganyiko, ubadilishaji wa strandi hufanyika mara kwa mara wakati wa kunakiliwa kwa CoV RNA.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: RNA zinazofanana zaidi za urefu kamili na za genome ndogo zinaweza kuungana tena ili kuzalisha COV mpya.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Ushahidi wa kifilojenetiki wa uunganishaji tena asilia umepatikana katika HCoV-HKU1 pamoja na HCoV-OC43, pamoja na CoV vilivyopatikana ndani ya wanyama kama vile bat SL-CoV na batCoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Mwingiliano wa mbebaji virusi ukihusishwa na usambazaji

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Kando na vigezo vitatu vya virusi vilivyotajwa hapa juu, mwingiliano wa kivirusi vipokezi vya mbebaji ni kigezo kingine muhimu chenye ushawishi kwenye usambazaji baina ya viumbe.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Hapa ndani, kuunganishwa tena SARS-CoV kunazingatiwa kuwa mfano wa kawaida, ambao pia ulionyesha ushahidi wa uteuzi chanya wakati wa matukio ya usambazaji baina ya viumbe.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Kulingana na uchanganuzi wa kiulinganisho kati ya SARS-CoV ndani ya binadamu na ngawa, SARS-CoV inadhaniwa kuzoeleka haraka ndani ya wabebaji tofauti, hasa na mabadiliko katika RBD ya protini ya S.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Kwa ujumla, RBD kwenye protini ya S ya CoV huingiliana na kipokezi cha seli na inateuliwa kwa kina na jibu la antibodi ya mbebaji.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: Katika SARS-CoV, RBD ndiyo amino asidi ya 318 na ya 510 katika kipande cha S1, ambayo hunata ACE2 ya kibinadamu pamoja na vipokezi vikuu kwa ajili ya ingizo la virusi.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: RBD ya SARS-CoV ina uwezo wa kutambua vipokezi vya ACE2 vya wanyama mbalimbali, ikiwa ni pamoja na popo, ngawa, panya na mbwa, na kuruhusu usambazaji wa virusi baina ya viumbe.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Hakika, ni mabaki 6 ya amino asidi pekee ndiyo yalitazamwa kuwa tofauti kutoka kwa virusi vilivyotengwa kutoka kwa binadamu na ngawa kwenye RBD na 4 kati yazo zipo katika sehemu ya kuunganisha vipokezi kwa ajili ya miingiliano na kipokezi cha ACE2.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: SARS-CoV vilivyo ndani ya Ngawa vina mabadiliko ya K479N na S487T kwenye RBD yavyo, jambo linaloweza kuzidisha uwezekano wa mwingiliano wa protini ya S na vipokezi vya binadamu vya ACE2.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Yaani, amino asidi hizi mbili zinaweza kuwa muhimu katika virusi kuzoeleka kwa binadamu.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ni muhimu kukumbuka kwamba SARS-CoV-2 vina vipokezi sawa vya seli na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Tofauti ya 30% kati ya SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV kwenye kitengo cha S1 cha protini ya S inaashiria kwamba uwezo wa protini ya S kuunganishwa na ACE2 ya binadamu huenda umebadilisha.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Bila shaka, utafiti wa cryo-EM unaonyesha uwezekano wa mnato wa 10- hadi 20-zaidi wa mnato huu kuliko kati ya protini ya binadamu ya ACE2 na ya SARS-CoV S.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Itakuwa jambo la kuvutia kubaini iwapo vitambuzi vyovyote vyenza vinaweza kuhitajika kwa ajili ya usambazaji wa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Inashangaza kwamba, HCoV-NL63 pia hunata kwenye ACE2 lakini kwa sehemu tofauti ya S.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Kuna vitambuzi vingine vingi vya HCoV, kama vile aminopeptidase N vya HCoV-229E, na asidi ya kupambana na gluteni ya 9-O-acetylated vya HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Vinaweza pia kuwajibikia ufanisi wa kuzoeleka kwa CoV hivi kwa binadamu baada ya kusambazwa baina ya viumbe kutoka wa wanyama wabebaji.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Pamoja na vitambuzi vya seli, matokeo ya usambazaji wa HCoV baina viumbe pia inatawaliwa na utegemezi na wabebaji wengine na vigezo vya uzuiaji.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Tofauti ya protini hizi za wanyama wabebaji kati ya binadamu na wabebaji asilia wahifadhi wa virusi vya HCoV kama vile popo, ngamia warefu zaidi na panya huenda ukawa kikwazo kwa usambazaji baina ya viumbe.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ni lazima HCoV vivamie vipengee vya utegemezi vya mbebaji virusi na kubadilisha vipengee vya uzuiaji vya mbebaji virusi ili kufanikiwa kusambaza virusi baina ya viumbe.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Kwa mintaarafu hii, vibainishi vya kimolekuli katika sehemu hii muhimu ya mwingiliano baina ya virusi na mbebaji wake bado havijatambuliwa na kuainishwa.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Ukaguzi yakinifu wa utegemezi wa mbebaji wa jenomu na vigezo vya uzuiaji vya SARS-CoV-2 kwa kutumia teknolojia ya aina yake ya CRISPR huenda ukazaa matunda.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Kuibuka kwa HCoV vipya: nyuma kabisa

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Aina mbalimbali za bat CoV hutoa fursa ya kipekee kwa kuibuka kwa HCoV vipya.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Kwa mantiki hii, bat CoV hutumika kama kikoa cha jeni cha HCoV mbalimbali.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Pamoja na hayo, kubadilika haraka na kuunganishwa kijenetiki pia huwezesha ukuaji wa HCoV na huwa hatua mbili muhimu katika mchakato huu.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Kwa mfano, kupata au kupoteza jeni mpya inayosimba protini kuna uwezekano wa kubadilisha haraka sampuli ya virusi.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Miongoni mwa protini za ufikiaji za SARS-CoV, ORF8 imedhaniwa kuwa muhimu katika kuzoeleka kwa binadamu, kwa vile virusi vya SARS-CoV vinavyohusiana na popo vilitengwa lakini vikapatikana kusimba protini tofauti za ORF8.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: Sifa ya ufutaji wa nucleotide 29 ya SARS-CoV imepatikana katika sampuli zilizotengwa mwanzoni mwa janga la binadamu.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Kufutwa huku hugawa ORF8 ikawa ORF8a na ORF8b na inadhaniwa kuwa mabadiliko ya kuzoeleka yanayohimiza kubadilishwa kwa wabebaji virusi.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Vilevile, SARS-CoV ina uwezekano wa kuwa na historia ya kuunganishwa na vizazi vya alpha- na gamma-CoVs, ambapo idadi kubwa ya maeneo madogo madogo ya vipengee vya kuunganishwa vilitambuliwa kwenye RNA polymerase inayotegemea RNA.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Maeneo ya kuunganishwa tena pia yalitambuliwa katika nsp9, nsp10 nyingi na sehemu za nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Vilevile, imeonyeshwa kwamba janga la MERS-CoV lililoshuhudiwa katika matukio ya kuunganishwa tena kati ya vizazi tofauti, uliotokea katika ngamia warefu zaidi nchini Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Kando na SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, matukio ya kuunganishwa tena kuwa aina nyingine HCoV yameshuhudiwa pia, ambapo HCoV mbalimbali zinaunginishwa tena na CoV nyingine za mnyama kwenye jeni zao zisizo na umbo.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Tahadhari pia inapaswa kutolewa kwamba uteuzi wa bandia unaweza kuchangia katika mabadiliko yasiyonuiwa katika jenomu za virusi, mara nyingi kutokana na kuondolea virusi mashinikizo ya uteuzi, kama vile mfumo wa kinga ya mwili wa mbebaji virusi.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Mfano wa athari hizi ni kupotea kwa ORF4 vya urefu kamilifu katika sampuli ya HCoV-229E, kutokana na kufutwa kwa nucleotide mbili.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Huku ORF4 thabiti ingeweza kutazamwa kwenye virusi vinavyopatikana kwenye popo na ngamia vinavyohusiana na HCoV-229E, alpha-CoV vilivyopatikana kwenye alpaca vilionyesha mweko mmoja wa nucleotide na kusababisha kubadilika kwa fremu.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Hatimaye, ukuaji wa virusi vipya vya HCoV pia unatokana na shinikizo la uteuzi kwenye hifadhi ya mbebaji virusi.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Kutokuwepo kwa dalili au dalili za wastani tu ndizo ziligunduliwa wakati popo waliambukizwa na CoV, hii inaashiria kuzoeleka kwa pamoja kati ya CoV na popo.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Ilionekana kwamba popo virusi vya CoV vilizoeleka kwa popo vyema kimuundo na kiutendakazi wa mwili.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Kwa mfano, hitilafu katika kukabiliana na hali ya kuchomeka ndani ya popo ilifanikisha kupunguza uwezo wa CoV kusababisha ugonjwa.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Vilevile, shughuli ya seli ya uuwaji asilia kwenye popo inadidimizwa kutokana na kuzalishwa kwa vitambuzi vizuizi vya seli ya uuwaji asilia NKG2/CD94 na kiwango cha chini cha molekuli za aina ya I za mchanganyiko wa uoanifu wa tishu.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Isitoshe, kiwango kikubwa cha aina ya hewa tendaji (ROS) inayozalishwa kutokana na shughuli nyingi za kimwili za popo kinaweza kudidimiza mwigo wa CoV na kuathiri mapitio ya exoribonuclease, hivyo kutoa shinikizo la uteuzi kwa ajili ya uzalishaji wa aina ya virusi vilivyo vya kipathogentiki kwa hali ya juu vinapoingizwa katika mazingira mapya.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Sampuli zaidi za kusababisha ugonjwa za CoV zinaweza kukua kupitia uunganishaji tena, na kusababisha kupatikana kwa protini mpya au sifa za protini kwa ajili ya kuzoeleka kwenye mbebaji.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Hivyo, si ajabu kuwa virusi vitatu vipya vya HCoVs vimeibuka katika kipindi cha miongo miwili iliyopita.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: Virusi vya CoV havina uwezo wa kusababisha ugonjwa au husababisha dalili za wastani kwa wabebaji wahifadhi wao kama vile popo na ngamia.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Vinazalishwa kwa wingi bila kuonyesha makabiliano ya kinga thabiti ya mwili ya mbebaji wake.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Hapa ndani kuna siri kuhusu ni kwa nini wabebaji virusi wasio na dalili huonekana na kinachosababisha hali mbaya katika maambukizi ya binadamu.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Dalili zake zinatokana na kuchochewa sana na kinga ya mwili kupigana kupita kiasi na mlipuko wa saitokini ambapo kinga ya mwili likiwa thabiti sana, mapafu huharibika zaidi.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, kwa wabebaji wasio na dalili, makabiliano ya kinga ya mwili hutenganishwa kutoka kwa uzalishaji wa CoV.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Mkakati sawa wa kutenganisha makabiliano ya kinga ya mwili unaweza kuwa na manufaa katika tiba dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Jibu la protini zinazotolewa na mbebaji virusi ni thabiti hususan kwenye popo.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Hivyo, kutolewa kwa protini zinazotolewa na mbebaji virusi za aina ya I angalau katika awamu ya mapema ya maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 kwenye binadamu kunapaswa kuwa na manufaa.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Isitoshe, kuamilishwa kwa NLRP3 inflammasome kwenye popo kuna madhara.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Kwa mantiki hii, kuzuia NLRP3 inflammasome kwa kutumia MCC950 kunaweza kuwa muhimu katika matibabu ya COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Kuibuka kwa SARS-CoV-2 kunafuata mtindo wa kijumla ambapo SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV viliibuka.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ingawa beta-CoV vya popo vilivyo na mfanano wa 95% wa nucleotide na SARS-CoV vimepatikana, pia kuna bat-CoV iliyo na mfanano wa 96% wa nucleotide na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Ijapokuwa ngawa na wanyama wengine sokoni wamepatikana kuwa na virusi vinavyofanana na SARS-CoV, wabebaji wa kati wa karibu wa SARS-CoV-2 hawajatambuliwa.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Beta-CoVs vinavyopatikana kwa kakakuona ambavyo vinafanana sana na SARS-CoV-2 vimepatikana, hii inaashiria kwamba kakakuona wanaweza kuwa wabebaji wa kati au beta-CoV vinavyopatikana kwa kakakuona vinaweza kuchangia vipande vya jeni kwa aina ya mwisho ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Ingawa maswali bado yanasalia, hakuna ushahidi kwamba SARS-CoV-2 vimetengenezwa na binadamu ama kwa kukusudia au kwa ajili.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: CoV vimerejea kumilikwa tena kutokana na mkurupuko wa hivi majuzi wa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Utafiti wa CoV ndani ya popo na wanyama wengine umebadilisha haraka mitazamo yetu kuhusu umuhimu wa machimbuko ya wanyama na uhifadhi wa wanyama wa HCoV katika usambazaji kwa binadamu.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Ushahidi uliotanda kote umeonyesha kwamba SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2 vina chimbuko kutoka kwa popo na vinasambazwa kwa binadamu kupitia wabebaji wa kati.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Kwa kuwa maambukizi ya SARS-CoV yanatokana na mgusano kati ya binadamu na ngawa sokoni, kufunga soko za wanyama na kuwauwa ngawa wote mle kungesaidia kukomesha janga la SARS kwa ufanisi.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kwa mantiki sawa na hiyo, kakakuona wanapaswa kuondolewa kwenye soko la wanyama ili kuzuia usambazaji wa wanyama, kutokana na ugunduzi wa vizazi vingi vya beta-CoV vinavyopatikana kwa kakakuona vinavyohusiana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Hata hivyo, iwapo na jinsi virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 husambazwa kwa binadamu kupitia kakakuona na wanyama wengine inasalia kuwekwa wazi katika uchunguzi wa siku zijazo.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, MERS-CoV imekuwepo ndani ya ngamia warefu zaidi kwa muda mrefu.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Ngamia hawa wanatumika kama zana muhimu katika kusafirisha pamoja na chanzo kikuu cha nyama, maziwa, bidhaa za ngozi na sufu kwa watu mtaani.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Wamesambaa pakubwa kote Mashariki ya Kati na Afrika.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kwa hivyo haiwezekani kuwauwa ngamia wote ili kudhibiti MERS, kama ilivyofanywa katika masoko ya wanyama wa porini nchini China ili kuzuia kuenea kwa SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Ili kukomesha mikurupuko ya mara kwa mara ya MERS, mwelekeo tondoti unapaswa kuchukuliwa ili kuunda chanjo faafu dhidi ya MERS-CoV kwa ngamia, pamoja na hatua nyingine ya kudhibiti maambukizi.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Kwa sababu hatuwezi kuondoa virusi hivi, aina mpya inaweza kuibuka kusababisha mikurupuko.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Aina nyingi za CoV vinayosambazwa na wanyama vinasambazwa porini.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Hususan, CoV vinavyoletwa na popo vyenye uwezo wa kusambazwa na wanyama ni anuwai mno.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Kuna nafasi kubwa kwamba CoV vingi vinavyosambwa na wanyama vikue na kuungana tena na kusababisha kuibuka kwa CoV vingine ambavyo vinasambazwa zaidi na/au ni hatari zaidi kwa binadamu siku zijazo.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Utamaduni wa kula wanyama wa porini katika baadhi ya maeneo nchini China unapaswa kuachwa ili kupunguza mgusano kati ya binadamu na wanyama.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Kukiwa na matatizo ya SARS, MERS na COVID-19, hali ya kujitayarisha vyema na mpango wa kukabiliana unapaswa kuwekwa.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Hakika, virusi vingi vimekuwepo duniani kwa muda mrefu.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Vinakaa katika hifadhi zao asilia hadi wakati kuna nafasi ya kusambaa.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Ingawa popo wana sifa nyingi zinazowezesha kusambaa kwa virusi, nafasi ya binadamu kugusana na popo na viumbe vingine vya porini inaweza kupunguzwa ikiwa watu wataelimishwa kukaa mbali ya wanyama hao.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Ni muhimu uchunguzi kuendelea kwa wanyama ili kuelewa vyema ekolojia ya CoV na wabebaji wao asilia, jambo litakalodhihirisha kuwa muhimu katika kuzuia usambazaji kutoka kwa mnyama hadi kwa binadamu na mikurupuko siku zijazo.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Kuhitimisha, njia faafu zaidi ya kuzuia usambazaji wa virusi kutoka kwa wanyama ni kwa binadamu kukaa mbali na mazingira ya kiekolojia ya wahifadhi asilia wa virusi vinavyosambazwa kutoka kwa wanyama.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Bado kuna mambo mengi yasiyopatikana kuhusu chimbuko la SARS-CoV-2 kutoka kwa wanyama.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Kwanza, ikiwa popo wanasambaza virusi vya kijadi vya SARS-CoV-2 kwa kakakuona, itakuwa jambo la kuvutia kuona ni katika hali zipi popo na kakakuona wanaweza wakapatikana katika mazingira sawa ya kiekolojia.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Pili, iwapo popo wana nafasi ya moja kwa moja zaidi katika usambazaji kwa binadamu, jinsi binadamu hugusana na popo inapaswa kubainiwa.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Tatu, ikiwa kuna mnyama wa tatu anayetumika kama mbebaji halisi wa kati, jinsi mnyama huyo huingiliana na viumbe vingine ikiwa ni pamoja na binadamu, popo na kakakuona inapaswa kuwekwa wazi.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Hatimaye, kwa vile wanyama wengine ikiwa ni pamoja na wanyama wa nyumbani wanaweza kuwa hatarini kupata SARS-CoV-2, maambukizi ya kiuchunguzi na kimajaribio yanapaswa kuendeshwa.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Ikiwa ni popo, kakauona au mnyama mwingine, inatarajiwa kwamba SARS-CoV-2 au virusi vyake mama ambavyo vinakaribia kufanana vitatambuliwa kwenye wabebaji wake asilia siku zijazo.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Kuendelea kwa uchunguzi katika uwanja huu kutapambanua njia ya ukuaji wa SARS-CoV-2 kwenye wanyama, na athari muhimu ikiwa katika uzuiaji na udhibiti wa COVID-19 kwa binadamu.

sourceString: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020
targetString: Makadirio ya Awali ya Maambukizi ya Hali Teule Sugu Miongoni mwa Wagonjwa wa Ugonjwa wa Virusi vya Korona 2019 — Marekani, Tarehe 12 Februari –28 Machi 2020

sourceString: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) a pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 11 2020, Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni lilitangaza Ugonjwa wa Virusi vya Korona 2019 (COVID-19) kuwa ni janga kubwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 26,494 deaths have been reported worldwide.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, jumla ya visa 571,678 vya COVID-19 na vifo 26,494 vimeripotiwa ulimwenguni kote.

sourceString: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe disease include older age and the presence of at least one of several underlying health conditions.
targetString: Ripoti kutoka China na Italia zinaonyesha kwamba vigezo vya hatari vya ugonjwa mbaya ni pamoja na umri mkubwa na kuwepo kwa angalau moja kati ya hali kadhaa sugu za kiafya.

sourceString: U.S. older adults, including those aged ≥65 years and particularly those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated outcomes; however, data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Watu wazima wazee nchini Marekani, wakiwemo wale walio na miaka ≥65 na hususan wale walio na umri wa ≥85, pia wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa ya kuwa na matokeo yanayohusiana na COVID-19; hata hivyo, data inayoeleza hali sugu za afya miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19 nchini Marekani bado haijaripotiwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, U.S. states and territories have reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, including 7,162 (5.8%) for whom data on underlying health conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections were reported.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, majimbo na himaya za Marekani zimeripoti visa 122,653 vya COVID-19 nchini Marekani kwa CDC, ikiwa ni pamoja na 7,162 (5.8%) ambao kwao kuliripotiwa data kuhusu hali sugu za afya na vigezo vingine vya hatari kwa matokeo mabaya kutokana na maambukizi ya pumu.

sourceString: Among these 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying health condition or risk factor, and 4,470 (62.4%) had none of these conditions reported.
targetString: Miongoni mwa visa hivi 7,162, wagonjwa 2,692 (37.6%) walikuwa na hali moja au zaidi sugu au kigezo cha hatari na 4,470 (62.4%) hawakuwa na hali hizi.

sourceString: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying health condition or risk factor was higher among those requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission (358 of 457, 78%) and those requiring hospitalization without ICU admission (732 of 1,037, 71%) than that among those who were not hospitalized (1,388 of 5,143, 27%).
targetString: Asilimia ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 waliokuwa na angalau hali moja sugu ya afya au kigezo cha hatari ilikuwa juu miongoni mwa wale waliohitaji kulazwa kwenye chumba cha kuhudumia wagonjwa mahututi ICU (358 kati ya 457, 78%) na wale waliohitaji kulazwa hospitalini lakini sio katika ICU kwa 9732 kati ya 1,037, 71%) kuliko miongoni mwa wale ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini (1,388 kati ya 5,143, 27%).

sourceString: The most commonly reported conditions were diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease.
targetString: Hali zilizoripotiwa zaidi zilikuwa kisukari, ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu na ugonjwa wa matatizo ya moyo.

sourceString: These preliminary findings suggest that in the United States, persons with underlying health conditions or other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at a higher risk for severe disease from COVID-19 than are persons without these conditions.
targetString: Matokeo haya ya awali yanapendekeza kwamba nchini Marekani, watu walio na hali sugu za afya au vigezo vingine vinayotambuliwa vya hatari kwa ajili ya matokeo mabaya kutokana na maambukizi ya pumu wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa zaidi ya ugonjwa mbaya kutoka COVID-19 kuliko watu bila hali hizi.

sourceString: Data from laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases reported to CDC from 50 states, four U.S. territories and affiliated islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City with February 12–March 28, 2020 onset dates were analyzed.
targetString: Data kutoka visa vya COVID-19 vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara zilizoripotiwa kwa CDC kutoka majimbo 50, himaya nne za Marekani na visiwa husiani, Wilaya ya Kolombia na Jiji la New York zikiwa na tarehe za kuanza baina ya 12 Februari - 28 Machi 2020, zilichanganuliwa.

sourceString: Cases among persons repatriated to the United States from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship were excluded.
targetString: Visa miongoni mwa watu waliorejeshwa nyumbani nchini Marekani kutoka Wuhan, China na meli ya Diamond Princess havikujumuishwa.

sourceString: For cases with missing onset dates, date of onset was estimated by subtracting 4 days (median interval from symptom onset to specimen collection date among cases with known dates in these data) from the earliest specimen collection.
targetString: Katika visa vilivyokosa tarehe ya kuanza, tarehe ya kuanza ilikadiriwa kwa kuondoa siku 4 (muda wa kati kutoka kuanza kwa dalili hadi kukusanywa kwa data miongoni kwa visa vilivyo na tarehe zinazojulikana kwenye data hizi) kutoka wakati mapema zaidi sampuli ilipokusanywa.

sourceString: Public health departments reported cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that captures information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease (inclusive of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], and emphysema); diabetes mellitus; cardiovascular disease; chronic renal disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised condition; neurologic disorder, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disability; pregnancy; current smoking status; former smoking status; or other chronic disease.
targetString: Idara za afya ya umma ziliripoti visa kwa CDC kwa kutumia fomu ya kawaida ya kuripoti visa ambayo ilinakili taarifa (ndiyo, la au haijulikani) kuhusu hali zifuatazo na vigezo vinavyoweza kuwa hatari: ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu (ikiwa ni pamoja na matatizo ya kupumua, ugonjwa sugu wa kufungwa kwa mishipa ya damu [CPD] na kukatika pumu); kisukari; ugonjwa wa moyo; ugonjwa sugu wa njia ya mkojo; ugonjwa sugu wa maini; hali ya kuingiliwa kwa kinga ya mwili; matatizo ya kiakili, ukuaji wa kiakili au ulemavu wa kiakili; ujauzito; hali ya sasa ya kutumia sigara; hali ya zamani ya kutumia sigara au magonjwa mengine sugu.

sourceString: Data reported to CDC are preliminary and can be updated by health departments over time; critical data elements might be missing at the time of initial report; thus, this analysis is descriptive, and no statistical comparisons could be made.
targetString: Data zilizoripotiwa kwa CDC ni za awali na zinazoweza kusasishwa na idara ya afya muda baada ya muda; vipengele muhimu vya data vinaweza kukosekana wakati wa ripoti ya awali; hivyo, uchanganuzi huu ni fafanuzi na hakuna ulinganisho wa kitakwimu ambao ungeweza kufanywa.

sourceString: The percentages of patients of all ages with underlying health conditions who were not hospitalized, hospitalized without ICU admission, and hospitalized with ICU admission were calculated.
targetString: Hesabu ya asilimia ya wagonjwa wa umri zote waliokuwa na hali sugu za afya ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini, waliolazwa hospitalini bila kuwekwa katika chumba cha kushughulikiwa wagonjwa mahututi ICU na waliolazwa hospitalini kwenye chumba cha kushughulikiwa wagonjwa mahututi ICU ilipigwa.

sourceString: Percentages of hospitalizations with and without ICU admission were estimated for persons aged ≥19 years with and without underlying health conditions.
targetString: Makadirio ya asilimia ya wagonjwa waliolazwa hospitalini kwa kulazwa au bila kulazwa katika chumba cha wagonjwa walio katika hali mahututi wenye umri wa ≥19 waliokuwa na wasiokuwa na hali sugu yalifanywa.

sourceString: This part of the analysis was limited to persons aged ≥19 years because of the small sample size of cases in children with reported underlying health conditions (N = 32).
targetString: Sehemu hii ya uchanganuzi ulifanywa kwa watu wenye umri wa ≥19 pekee kwa sababu ya sampuli ndogo ya visa vya watoto waliokuwa na hali sugu zilizoripotiwa (N = 32).

sourceString: To account for missing data among these preliminary reports, ranges were estimated with a lower bound including cases with both known and unknown status for hospitalization with and without ICU admission as the denominator and an upper bound using only cases with known outcome status as the denominator.
targetString: Ili kuwajibikia ukosefu wa data miongoni mwa ripoti za awali, tofauti zilikadiriwa huku upeo wa chini zaidi ukijumuisha visa vinavyojulikana na visivyojulikana vya hali ya watu kulazwa hospitalini ama kwa matibabu ya watu walio katika hali mahututi au la kama kigezo msingi na upeo wa juu ukitumia tu visa vilivyo na matokeo yanayojulikana kama kigezo msingi.

sourceString: Because of small sample size and missing data on underlying health conditions among COVID-19 patients who died, case-fatality rates for persons with and without underlying conditions were not estimated.
targetString: Kwa sababu ya kiwango kidogo cha sampuli na kutokuwepo kwa data kuhusu hali sugu za afya miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19 waliofariki, viwango vya vifo vya kila kisa kwa watu walio na, na wasio na hali sugu za afya havikukadiriwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases (Figure) and 2,112 deaths were reported to CDC.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, jumla ya visa 122,653 vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara (Picha) na vifo 2,122 viliripotiwa kwa CDC.

sourceString: Case report forms were submitted to CDC for 74,439 (60.7%) cases.
targetString: Fomu za kuripoti visa zilizowasilishwa kwa CDC kwa ajili ya visa 74,439 (60.7%).

sourceString: Data on presence or absence of underlying health conditions and other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) were available for 7,162 (5.8%) patients (Table 1).
targetString: Data kuhusu kuwepo au kutokuwepo kwa hali sugu za afya na vigezo vingine vya hatari vinavyoweza kutambuliwa kwa ajili ya matokeo ya hali mbaya kutokana na maambukizi ya njia ya pumu (yaani., uvutaji sigara na ujauzito) zilipatikana kwa wagonjwa 7,162 (5.8%) (Jedwali la 1).

sourceString: Approximately one third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%), had at least one underlying condition or risk factor.
targetString: Takriban thuluthi moja ya wagonjwa hawa (2,692, 37.6%), walikuwa na angalau hali moja sugu au kigezo cha hatari.

sourceString: Diabetes mellitus (784, 10.9%), chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%), and cardiovascular disease (647, 9.0%) were the most frequently reported conditions among all cases.
targetString: Kisukari (784, 10.9%), ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu (656, 9.2%) na ugnjwa wa moyo (647, 9.0%) ndizo hali zilizoripotia mara nyingi zaidi kati ya visa vyote.

sourceString: Among 457 ICU admissions and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalizations, 358 (78%) and 732 (71%), respectively occurred among persons with one or more reported underlying health condition.
targetString: Miongoni mwa watu 457 waliolazwa katika Chumba cha watu Mahututi na 1,037 ambao walilazwa hospitalini lakini sio katika chumba cha watu mahututi, 358 (78%) na 732 (71%), mtawalia ulitokea miongoni mwa watu walioripoti hali moja au zaidi sugu ya kiafya.

sourceString: In contrast, 1,388 of 5,143 (27%) COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized were reported to have at least one underlying health condition.
targetString: Ikilinganishwa, idadi ya wagonjwa 1,388 kati ya 5,143 (27%) wa COVID-19 ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini waliripotiwa kuwa na angalau hali moja sugu ya kiafya.

sourceString: Among patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of non-ICU hospitalizations was higher among those with underlying health conditions (27.3%–29.8%) than among those without underlying health conditions (7.2%–7.8%); the percentage of cases that resulted in an ICU admission was also higher for those with underlying health conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than those without these conditions (2.2%–2.4%) (Table 2).
targetString: Miongoni mwa wagojwa wenye umri wa miaka ≥19, asilimia ya wagonjwa waliolazwa hospitalini bila kuweka katika chumba cha ICU ilikuwa juu zaidi (27.3%–29.8%) kwa watu ambao walikuwa na hali sugu za afya kuliko kwa wale ambao hawakuwa na hali sugu za afya (7.2%–7.8%); asilimia ya visa vilivyosababisha wagonjwa kulazwa kwenye ICU pia ilikuwa juu kwa watu waliokuwa na hali sugu za afya kwa (13.3%–14.5%) kuliko wale ambao hawakuwa na hali hizi (2.2%–2.4%) (Jedwali la 2).

sourceString: Small numbers of COVID-19 patients aged < 19 years were reported to be hospitalized (48) or admitted to an ICU (eight).
targetString: Idadi ndogo ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 walio na umri wa < 19 waliripotiwa kulazwa hospitalini (48) au kulazwa katika chumba cha watu walio katika hali mahututi ICU (wanane).

sourceString: In contrast, 335 patients aged < 19 years were not hospitalized and 1,342 had missing data on hospitalization.
targetString: Kwa ulinganifu, wagonjwa 335 wenye umri wa miaka chini ya < 19 hawakulazwa hopitalini na 1,342 hawakuwa na data yoyote kuhusu kulazwa hospitalini.

sourceString: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying conditions or risk factors, 184 deaths occurred (all among patients aged ≥19 years); 173 deaths (94%) were reported among patients with at least one underlying condition.
targetString: Miongoni mwa wagonjwa wote wa COVID-19 walio na maelezo kamili kuhusu hali sugu au vigezo vya hatari, vifo 184 vilitokea (vyote miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa umri wa miaka ≥19); vifo 173 (94%) viliripotiwa miongoni mwa wagonjwa wenye angalau hali moja sugu.

sourceString: Among 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC as of March 28, 2020, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data available pertaining to underlying health conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, higher percentages of patients with underlying conditions were admitted to the hospital and to an ICU than patients without reported underlying conditions.
targetString: Miongoni mwa visa 122,653 vya COVID-19 nchini Marekani vilivyoripotiwa kwa CDC kuikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, wagonjwa 7,162 (5.8%) walikuwa na data kuhusiana na hali sugu ya afya au uwezekano wa kuwepo vigezo vya hatari; miongonimwa wagonjwa hawa, asilimia ya juu ya wagonjwa wenye hali sugu za afya ililazwa hospitalini na kwenye ICU kuliko wagonjwa ambao hawakuwa na hali sugu.

sourceString: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, which suggest that patients with underlying health conditions and risk factors, including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic renal disease, and smoking, might be at higher risk for severe disease or death from COVID-19.
targetString: Matokeo haya yanaambatana na matokeo kutoka China na Italia, ambayo yanaashiria kwamba wagonjwa wenye hali sugu za afya na vigezo vya hatari, ikiwa ni pamoja lakini sio tu, kisukari, mshtuko wa moyo, COPD, ugonjwa wa moyo, ugonjwa wa ubongo, ugonjwa sugu wa njia ya mkojo na uvutaji sigara, huenda wakawa katika hatari kuwa zaidi ya kupata ugonjwa mbaya au kufa kutokana na COVID-19.

sourceString: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data because of the burden placed on reporting health departments with rapidly rising case counts, and these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Uchanganuzi huu ulikumbwa na changamoto kutokana na idadi ndogo na kukosekana kwa data kwa sababu ya uzito uliowekewa idara za afya zinazoripoti kukiwa na idadi inayoongezeka haraka ya visa na matokeo haya yanaweza kubadilika data ya ziada ikiendelea kupatikana.

sourceString: It is not yet known whether the severity or level of control of underlying health conditions affects the risk for severe disease associated with COVID-19.
targetString: Bado haijulikani iwapo uzito au kiwango cha udhibiti wa hali sugu za afya huathiri hatari ya ugonjwa mbaya unaohusiana na COVID-19.

sourceString: Many of these underlying health conditions are common in the United States: based on self-reported 2018 data, the prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1%, and the U.S. age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease (excluding hypertension without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017.
targetString: Hali nyingi hizi sugu ziliripotiwa nchini Marekani: kulingana na data ya walioripoti wenyewe ya 2018, maambukizi ya visa vya kisukari vilivyopimwa miongoni mwa watu wazima nchini Marekani yalikuwa 10.1% na maambukizi yaliyorekebishwa kulingana na umri nchini Marekani miongoni mwa aina zote za magonjwa ya moyo (bila kujumuisha mshtuko wa moyo bila ugonjwa mwingine wa moyo) yalikuwa 10.6% mwaka 2017.

sourceString: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the U.S. estimated prevalence of current asthma among persons of all ages was 7.9%.
targetString: Maambukizi yaliyorekebishwa kulingana na umri ya COPD miongoni mwa watu wazima nchini Marekani ni 5.9% na mnamo 2018, Marekani ilikadiria maambukizi ya ugonjwa wa pumu miongoni mwa watu wa umri wote ulikuwa 7.9%.

sourceString: CDC continues to develop and update resources for persons with underlying health conditions to reduce the risk of acquiring COVID-19.
targetString: CDC inaendelea kuunda na kusasisha rasilimali kwa ajili ya watu walio na hali sugu za afya ili kupunguza hatari ya kupata COVID-19.

sourceString: The estimated higher prevalence of these conditions among those in this early group of U.S. COVID-19 patients and the potentially higher risk for more severe disease from COVID-19 associated with the presence of underlying conditions highlight the importance of COVID-19 prevention in persons with underlying conditions.
targetString: Maambukizi mengi yaliyokadiriwa ya hali hizi miongoni mwa wale walio katika kikundi hiki cha mapema cha wagonjwa wa COVID-19 nchini Marekani na uwezekano wa hatari ya juu wa ugonjwa mbaya zaidi COVID-19 kutokana na kuwepo kwa hali sugu ukiangazia umuhimu wa kuzuia COVID-19 miongoni mwa watu walio na hali sugu za afya.

sourceString: The findings in this report are subject to at least six limitations.
targetString: Matokeo katika ripoti hii yanakabiliwa na angalau vizuizi sita.

sourceString: First, these data are preliminary, and the analysis was limited by missing data related to the health department reporting burden associated with rapidly rising case counts and delays in completion of information requiring medical chart review; these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Kwanza, data hii ni ya awali na uchanganuzi wake ulikuwa na vizuizi kutokana na kukosekana kwa data inayohusiana na idara ya afya kuripoti mzigo unaohusiana na idadi ya visa inayoendelea kukua na kucheleweshwa kukamilishwa kwa maelezo yanayohitaji ukaguzi wa chati ya kimatibabu; matokeo haya yanaweza kubadilika data ya ziada ikiendelea kupatikana.

sourceString: Information on underlying conditions was only available for 7,162 (5.8%) of 122,653 cases reported to CDC.
targetString: Maelezo kuhusu hali sugu yalikuwa yanapatikana kwa visa 7,162 (5.8%) kati ya 122,653 vilivyoripotiwa kwa CDC.

sourceString: It cannot be assumed that those with missing information are similar to those with data on either hospitalizations or underlying health conditions.
targetString: Haiwezi kuchukuliwa kuwa wale ambao maelezo yao hayapo ni sawa na wale walio na data kuhusu kulazwa hospitalini au hali sugu za afya.

sourceString: Second, these data are subject to bias in outcome ascertainment because of short follow-up time.
targetString: Pili, huenda data hii ina mapendeleo katika kuthibitisha matokeo kwa sababu ya muda mfupi wa kufuatilia.

sourceString: Some outcomes might be underestimated, and long-term outcomes cannot be assessed in this analysis.
targetString: Baadhi ya matokeo huenda yakakosa kupewa uzito nayo matokeo ya muda mrefu hayawezi kutathminiwa katika uchanganuzi huu.

sourceString: Third, because of the limited availability of testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis is likely biased toward more severe cases, and findings might change as testing becomes more widespread.
targetString: Tatu, kwa sababu ya kiwango cha chini cha vipimo katika maeneo mengi katika wakati huu, uchanganuzi huu huenda ukaegemea visa vibaya zaidi na matokeo yanaweza kubadilika vipimo vikiendelea katika maeneo mengi.

sourceString: Fourth, because of the descriptive nature of these data, attack rates among persons with and without underlying health conditions could not be compared, and thus the risk difference of severe disease with COVID-19 between these groups could not be estimated.
targetString: Nne, kwa sababu ya hali ya kiufafanuzi ya data hizi, viwango vya mashambulizi miongoni mwa watu walio na wasio na hali sugu za afya havingeweza kulinganisha na hivyo tofauti ya hatari ya ugonjwa mbaya pamoja COVID-19 kati ya vikundi hivi haingeweza kukadiriwa.

sourceString: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn about underlying conditions that were not included in the case report form or about different conditions that were reported in a single, umbrella category.
targetString: Tano, hakuna mahitimisho ambayo yangetolewa kuhusu hali sugu ambazo hazikujumuishwa kwenye fomu ya kuripoti visa au kuhusu hali tofauti ambazo ziliripotiwa katika kategoria moja ya jumla.

sourceString: For example, asthma and COPD were included in a chronic lung disease category.
targetString: Kwa mfano, magonjwa ya pumu na COPD yalijumuishwa kwenye kategoria ya ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu.

sourceString: Finally, for some underlying health conditions and risk factors, including neurologic disorders, chronic liver disease, being a current smoker, and pregnancy, few severe outcomes were reported; therefore, conclusions cannot be drawn about the risk for severe COVID-19 among persons in these groups.
targetString: Hatimaye, kwa baadhi ya hali sugu za afya na vigezo vya hatari, ikiwa ni pamoja na matatizo ya kinyurolojia, ugonjwa sugu wa ini, matumizi ya sigara kwa sasa na ujauzito, matokeo machache ya hali mbaya yaliripotiwa; kwa hivyo, mahitimisho hayawezi kuafikiwa kuhusu hatari ya magonjwa haya kwa COVID-19 miongoni mwa watu walio katika vikundi hivi.

sourceString: Persons in the United States with underlying health conditions appear to be at higher risk for more severe COVID-19, consistent with findings from other countries.
targetString: Watu walio Marekani walio na hali sugu za afya wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa zaidi kupata hali mbaya ya COVID-19, kuambatana na matokeo kutoka katika nchi nyingine.

sourceString: Persons with underlying health conditions who have symptoms of COVID-19, including fever, cough, or shortness of breath, should immediately contact their health care provider.
targetString: Watu walio na hali sugu za afya ambao wana dalili za COVID-19, ikiwa ni pamoja na joto jingi mwilini, kikohozi au ugumu wa kupumua, wanapaswa kuwasiliana na mtoa huduma wao wa afya mara moja.
