sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Katika nchi nyingi, kuna kiwango duni ya kuosha mikono kwa sabuni.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Utafiti wa kuosha mikono katika nchi 54 mnamo 2015 ilipata kuwa kwa wastani, 38.7% ya manyumba walikuwa wanaosha mikono yao kwa sabuni.Utafiti wa 2014 ilionyesha kuwa Saudi Arabia ilikuwa na kiwango cha juu zaidi ya asilimia 97; Marekani karibu katikati na asilimia 77; na Uchina na kiwango cha chini zaidi cha asilimia 23.Mbinu kadhaa ya kubadilisha tabia zipo kwa sasa kuongeza tabia ya kuosha mikono kwa sabuni katika hali ya hatari.Kuosha kwa mikono kwa vikundi kwa watoto wa shule katika masaa ya siku yaliyoratibiwa ni mojawapo wa mbinu katika nchi zinazoendelea kuwafunza na kuwakumbusha watoto kuwa na tabia ya kuosha mikono yao.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: Programu ya Kimsingi ya Huduma ya Afya iliyotekelezwa na Wizara ya Elimu huko Ufilipino ni mfano ya hatua ya hali ya juu kukuza afya na elimu ya watoto.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Kuuwa minyoo mara mbili kwa mwaka, ikiongezwa na kuosha mikono kila siku kwa sabuni, kupiga mswaki kila siku na flourini, ni msingi wa mradi huu wa taifa.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Imetekelezwa vyema pia huko Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Kuondolewa kwa viini kutoka ngozini kwa kuongeza sabuni au kemikali katika maji.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Kitendo muhimu wa sabuni na kemikali ni kupunguza vizuizi vya mchanganyiko, na kuongeza umumunyifu.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Maji pekee haina uwezo wa kusafisha ngozi kwa sababu mafuta na protini, ambazo ni vijenzi vya mchanga mahuluku, haviyeyushwi kwa urahisi katika maji.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Kusafisha, hata hivyo, husaidiwa na kuwepo mtiririko mzuri wa maji..

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Sabuni gumu, kwa sabau ya hali yake ya kutumika tena, huweza kuweka bakteria zilizopatikana kutoka kwa watumizi wa hapo awali.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Nambari chache ya uchunguzi ambazo zimeangalia usambazaji wa bakteria kutoka sabuni ngumu iliyoambukizwa imepata kuwa usambazaji si rahisi kutokea kwa sababu bakteria zinaoshwa na kuondoka na povu.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Rinse well under running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Kuna waundaji wa viunzi vya kukausha mikono, na kukausha kutumia viunzi vya kukausha mikono imelinganishwa dhidi ya kutumia tishu.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Kuosha mikono kwa kutumia tishu ya mikono yenye kioevu cha kuua viini ni njia mbadala wakati unasafiri na hakuna sabuni na maji.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: Kioevu cha kuua viini cha mikono inafaa kuwa na angalau 60% ya pombe.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Baada ya kupangusa, tishu inafaa kutumiwa kufunga maji (na kufungua mlango wowote wa kutoka nje kama inatakikana).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Hii huzuia kuambukiza tena mikono kutoka sehemu hizo.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Madhumuni ya kuosha mikono katika sehemu ya huduma za afya ni kuondoa viini vya magonjwa ("vijidudu") na kuzuia kuzisambaza.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Mwongozo rasimu ya usafi wa mikono la shirika huweza pia kupatikana katika tovuti yake kwa maoni ya umma.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Uchunguzi unaohusiana ulifanywa na Whitby na waandishi wengine.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Vifaa vya kibiashara zinaweza kupima na kuthibitisha usafi wa mikono, ikiwa maonyesho ya kufuata sheria inahitajika.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani ina "Nyakati Tano" ya kuosha mikono:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: baada ya kuwemo hatarini kwa damu/majimaji ya mwili

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: kabla ya jukumu linaloweza kuambukiza viini, na

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: baada ya kumhudumia mgonjwa. Kuongezwa kwa kemikali za kuua viini kwa sabuni (sabuni "yenye dawa" au "yenye viua-viini") huwezesha ajenti ya kuosha mikono kuweza kuua viini.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Uwezo kama huo wa kuua viini huweza kutakikana kabla ya kufanya upasuaji au katika mandhari ambayo viini ambavyo ni sugu kwa dawa za kuzuia na kuua bakteria zipo kwa wingi.Ku 'sugua' mikono yako kwa upasuaji, ni muhimu kuwa na mfereji unaoweza kufunguliwa na kufungwa bila kuushika kwa mikono, kiasi cha chlorhexidine au myeyusho wa iodini, taulo zilizo safi za kukausha mikono baada ya kuosha, brashi safi ya kusugua na kifaa kingine safi cha kusafisha chini ya makucha.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Vito zote zinafaa kutolewa.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Utaratibu huu inahitaji kuosha mikono na kigasha cha mikono hadi kwenye kisigino, kwa kawaida dakika 2-6.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Saa ndefu ya kusugua (dakika 10) sio muhimu.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Wakati unasuza, maji katika kigasha cha mkono lazima izuiliwe kutiririka nyuma kwa mikono.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Baada ya kuosha mikono imekamilika, mikono hupanguswa na nguo safi na gauni ya upasuaji inavaliwa.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Kupunguza usambazaji wa viini, ni vyema kuosha mikono au kutumia viua viini kabla na baada ya kuhudumia mgonjwa.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Kwa udhibiti wa maambukizi yanayosababishwa na bakteria katika hospitali, imegunduliwa kuwa faida kubwa zaidi kutoka kuosha mikono ilitokea katika 20% ya kwanza ya kuosha, na faida duni ilipatikana wakati kiwango cha kuosha mikono iliongezwa zaidi ya 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Kuosha kwa sabuni pekee inasababisha usambazaji zaidi ya ugonjwa wa maambukizi ya bakteria kwa chakula ikilinganishwa na kuosha na sabuni yenye kemikali ya kuua bakteria.Kulinganisha kusugua mikono kwa kutumia myeyesho ulio na pombe na kuosha mikono na sabuni iliyo na kemikali za kuua bakteria kwa muda wastani wa sekunde 30 ilionyesha kuwa kusugua mikono kwa pombe ilipunguza maambukizi ya bakteria 26% zaidi kuliko sabuni yenye kemikali ya kuua bakteria.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Lakini sabuni na maji yafaa zaidi kuliko myeyusho ya kusugua mikono yenye pombe kwa kupunguza virusi vya homa ya mafua ya H1N1 A na chembe za Clostrridium difficile kutoka mikono.Mikakati ya kuboresha usafi wa mikono katika mandhari ya huduma wa afya inaweza kuhusisha elimu ya wafanyakazi kwa kuosha mikono, kuongeza kupatikana kwa myeyusho ya kusugua mikino iliyo na pombe, na ukumbusho ulioandikwa na kusemwa kwa wafanyakazi.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Kuna hitaji ya utafiti zaidi katika ipi kati ya mikakati haya yana ufanisi katika mandhari tofauti ya huduma ya afya.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Katika nchi zinazoendelea, kuosha mikono kwa sabuni inatambulika kama kifaa chenye gharama duni, muhimu katika kupata afya njema, na hata lishe bora.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Hata hivyo, ukosefu wa maji unaotegemeka, vifaa vya kuosha mikono au sabuni katika nyumba za watu, shuleni na maeneo ya kazi huifanya kuwa changamoto kutimiza tabia ya ulimwengu ya kuosha mikono.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Kwa mfano, katika maeneo mengi vijijini mifereji ya kuosha mikono karibu na kila choo ya kibinafsi au ya umma ni chache, ingawa njia za bei nafuu zipo za kujenga vituo vya kuosha mikono.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Hata hivyo, viwango duni ya kuosha mikono pia huweza kuwa matokeo ya tabia ya kuzoea bali si kwa sababu ya kukosekana kwa sabuni au maji.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Ukuzaji na utetezi wa kuosha mikono kwa sabuni huweza kuathiri maamuzi ya sera, kuongeza ufahamu kuhusu manufaa ya

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Ili hii ifanye kazi kwa ufanisi, ufuatiliaji na utathmini ni muhimu.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa utaratibu wa utafiti 70 ulipata kuwa mbinu yanayohusisha jamii zina ufanifu katika kuongeza kuosha kwa mikono katika LMIC, ilhali kampeni za kuhimiza jamii kubadilisha tabia zina ufanifu duni.Mfano moja ya ukuzaji wa kuosha mikono katika shule ni "Mbinu ya Nyota Tatu" na UNICEF inayohimiza shule kuchukua hatua rahisi, yenye gharama duni kuhakikisha kuwa wanafunzi wanaosha mikono yao kwa sabuni, kati ya mahitaji mengine ya usafi.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Wakati viwango vya chini vimetimizwa, shule zinaweza kusonga kutoka nyota moja hadi mwishowe nyota tatu.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Kujenga vituo vya kuosha mikono zinaweza kuwa sehemu ya kampeni za kukuza kuosha mikono zinazotekelezwa ili kupunguza magonjwa na vifo vya watoto.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Siku ya Kuosha Mikono ya Dunia ni mfano mwingine ya kampeni ya kuongeza ufahamu inayojaribu kuleta mabadiliko ya tabia.Kutokana na jangwa la 2019-20 ya vurusi vya korona, UNICEF

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Uchunguzi chache zimezingatia gharama nafuu kwa jumla ya kuosha mikono katika nchi zinazoendelea kwa uhusiano na kipimo cha DALY.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Hata hivyo, uchunguzi moja inapendekeza kuwa kuhimiza kuosha kwa mikono kwa kutumia sabuni ni yenye gharama nafuu kuliko mikakati mengine ya maji na usafi.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Umuhimu wa kuosha mikono kwa afya ya binadamu - hasa kwa watu katika hali ya hatarini kama vile akina mama ambao wamejifungua au askari waliopata majeraha katika hospitali - iligunduliwa kwanza katika katikati ya karne ya 19 na watangulizi wawili wa usafi wa mikono: daktari kutoka Hungary Ignaz Semmelweis amabye alifanya kazi Vienna, Austria na Florence Nightingale, Mwiingereza "mwanzilishi wa uuguzi wa kisasa".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Wakati huo watu wengi bado waliamini kuwa maambukizi zilisababishwa na harufu mbaya iliyojulikana kama miasmas.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Mnamo muda wa 1980, mikurupuko yaliyosababishwa kupitia vyakula na maambukizi yaliyohusiana na huduma za afya ilifanya Kituo cha Uthibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa ya Marekani kuendeleza kikamilifu usafi wa mikono kama njia muhimu ya kuzuia kuenea kwa maambukizi.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Mkurupuko wa homa ya mafua mnamo 2009 na janga la COVID-19 mnamo 2020 ilisabababisha kuongezeka kwa ufahamu katika nchi nyingi ya umuhimu wa kuosha mikono kwa kutumia sabuni kujilinda kutoka magonjwa ya kuambukizwa kama hayo.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Kwa mfano, mabango yaliyoandikwa "mbinu sahihi ya kuosha mikono" yalibandikwa karibu na vituo vya kuosha mikono katika vyoo vya umma na katika vyoo vya majengo ya ofisi na viwanja vya ndege huko Ujerumani.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Kifungu "kuosha mikono yako katika" jambo, inamaanisha kutangaza kutotaka kuchukua jukumu kwa jambo au kujiunga na wengine katika jambo isiyo halali au ya kimaadili.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Inatoka katika kifungu cha bibilia katika Mathayo ambapo Pilato aliosha mikono yake kufuatia uamuzi wa kusulubisha Yesu Kristo, lakini imekuwa kifungu inayotumika pakubwa katika baadhi ya jamii ya Kiingereza.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Katika Macbeth ya Shakespeare, Binti Macbeth anaanza kuosha mikono yake kwa shurutisho ili kujaribu kusafisha doa inayodhaniwa, inayoashiria dhamiri ya hatia kuhusiana na uhalifu aliyotenda na kumshawishi bwana wake kutenda.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Imegunduliwa pia kuwa watu, baada ya kukumbuka au kutafakari matendo yasiyo na maadili, huosha mikono zaidi kuliko wengine, na huthamini vifaa vya kuosha mikono zaidi.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Zaidi ya hayo, wale wanaokubaliwa kuosha mikono yao baada ya kutafakari mambo kama haya wana uwezekano duni wa kujihusisha katika vitendo vya kulipia upungufu kwa "utakaso" mengine, kama vile kujitolea.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Dini huagiza kuosha mikono kwa sababu ya usafi na kama ishara. Kuosha mikono kama ishara, kwa kutumia maji lakini bila sabuni kuosha mikono, ni sehemu ya ibada ya kuosha mikono katika dini nyingi, ikiwemo Imani ya Bahá'í , Uhindu, tevilah and netilat yadayim katika Uyahudi, Lavabo katika Ukristo, na Wudhu katika Uislamu.Dini pia huagiza kuosha mikono kwa usafi, hasa baada ya vitendo fulani.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Uhindu, Uyahudi na Uislamu huagiza kuosha kwa mikono baada ya kutumia choo.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Na, Uhindu, Dini ya Buddha, Dini ya Sikh, Uyahudi na Uislamu huagiza kuosha mikono kabla ya na baada ya kila chakula.

sourceString: Impact of the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic on education
targetString: Athari ya janga la virusi vya korona ya 2019-20 katika elimu

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic has affected educational systems worldwide, leading to the widespread closures of schools and universities.
targetString: Janga la virusi vya korona ya 2019-20 imeathiri mifumo ya elimu ulimwenguni, na kusababisha kufungwa kwa shule nyingi na vyuo vikuu.

sourceString: As of 8 April 2020, approximately 1.716 billion learners have been affected due to school closures in response to COVID-19.
targetString: Kufikia 8 Aprili 2020, takriban wanafunzi bilioni 1.716 wameathiriwa kutokana na kufungwa kwa shule kufuatia COVID-19.

sourceString: According to UNESCO monitoring, 188 countries have implemented nationwide closures and 5 have implemented local closures, impacting about 99.4%  of the world's student population.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa ufuatilizi wa UNESCO, nchi 188 zimetekeleza kufungwa kwa sehemu kadhaa katika taifa na 5 zimetekeleza kufungwa kwa sehemu fulani, na kuathiri takriban 99.4% ya idadi ya wanafunzi duniani.

sourceString: On 23 March 2020, Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) released a statement announcing the cancellation of Cambridge IGCSE, Cambridge O Level, Cambridge International AS & A Level, Cambridge AICE Diploma, and Cambridge Pre-U examinations for the May/June 2020 series across all countries.
targetString: Tarehe 23 Machi 2020, Mitihani ya Kimataifa ya Cambridge (CIE) ilitoa taarifa ikitangaza kukatizwa kwa Cambridge IGCSE, Cambridge Kiwango cha O, Cambridge Kiwango cha AS & A, Cambridge AICE Diploma, na mitihani ya Cambridge kabla ya Chuo Kikuu kwa mfulilizo wa Mei/Juni 2020 katika nchi zote.

sourceString: International Baccalaureate exams have also been cancelled.School closures impact not only students, teachers, and families, but have far-reaching economic and societal consequences.
targetString: Mitihani ya International Baccalaureate pia zimekatizwa.Kufungwa kwa shule haiathiri wanafunzi, walimu, na familia pekee, lakini zina athari inayowaathiri wengi za kiuchumi na kijamii.

sourceString: School closures in response to COVID-19 have shed light on various social and economic issues, including student debt, digital learning, food insecurity, and homelessness, as well as access to childcare, health care, housing, internet, and disability services.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule kufuatia COVID-19 imemulika mambo tofauti ya kijamii na kiuchumi, ikiwemo deni ya wanafunzi, mafunzo kwa kutumia njia za kidijitali, kukosekana kwa chakula, na ukosefu wa makazi, pamoja na ufikivu kwa huduma ya kutunza watoto, huduma za afya, nyumba, mtandao, na huduma ya walemavu.

sourceString: The impact was more severe for disadvantaged children and their families, causing interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems, and consequent economic cost to families who could not work.In response to school closures, UNESCO recommended the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.
targetString: Athari hiyo ilikuwa mbaya zaidi kwa watoto wasiojiweza na familia zao, na kusababisha kukatizwa kwa masomo, lishe duni, matatizo ya ulezi wa watoto, na gharama iliyosababishwa kwa familia ambazo hazingeweza kufanya kazi.Kwa mujibu wa kufungwa kwa shule, UNESCO ilipendekeza matumizi ya mafunzo kupitia njia za kimtandao na programu fikivu za kielimu na jukwaa ambazo shule na walimu wanaweza kutumia kufikia wanafunzi mtandaoni na kupunguza kukatizwa kwa elimu.

sourceString: Efforts to stem the spread of COVID-19 through non-pharmaceutical interventions and preventive measures such as social-distancing and self-isolation have prompted the widespread closure of primary, secondary, and tertiary schooling in over 100 countries.Previous outbreaks of infectious diseases have prompted widespread school closings around the world, with varying levels of effectiveness.
targetString: Juhudu za kupunguza kuenea kwa COVID-19 kupitia mikakati ambazo hazihusishi madawa na hatua za kuzuia kama vile kutotangamana kwa watu na kujitenga imesababisha kufungwa kwa wingi ya shule za msingi, ya upili, na ya ngazi za juu katika zaidi ya nchi 100.Mikurupuko ya hapo awali ya magonjwa ya kuambukizwa imesababisha kufungwa kwa shule kote duniani, zikiwa na viwango tofauti ya ufanisi.

sourceString: Mathematical modelling has shown that transmission of an outbreak may be delayed by closing schools.
targetString: Mitindo ya kihesabu yameonyesha kuwa usambazaji wa mkurupuko huweza kucheleweshawa kwa kufunga shule.

sourceString: However, effectiveness depends on the contacts children maintain outside of school.
targetString: Hata hivyo, ufanisi inategemea na watu watoto wanotengamana nao nje ya shule.

sourceString: School closures may be effective when enacted promptly.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule huweza kuwa na ufanisi wakati inafanywa mapema.

sourceString: If school closures occur late relative to an outbreak, they are less effective and may not have any impact at all.
targetString: Ikiwa kufungwa kwa shule inafanywa kama imechelewa kulingana na mkurupuko, zina ufanisi duni na huenda zisiwe na athari yoyote.

sourceString: Additionally, in some cases, the reopening of schools after a period of closure has resulted in increased infection rates.
targetString: Kwa kuongezea, katika visa vingine, kufunguliwa kwa shule baada ya muda wa kufungwa imesababisha kuongezeka kwa viwango vya maambukizi.

sourceString: As closures tend to occur concurrently with other interventions such as public gathering bans, it can be difficult to measure the specific impact of school closures.During the 1918-1919 influenza pandemic in the United States, school closures and public gathering bans were associated with lower total mortality rates.
targetString: Kwa vile kufungwa huwa hufanyika kwa wakati moja na mikakati mengine kama vile kupigwa marufuku kwa mikusanyiko ya umma, inaweza kuwa vigumu kupima athari maalum ya kufungwa kwa shule.Katika kipindi cha janga la homa ya mafua ya 1918-1919 huko Marekani, kufungwa kwa shule na kupigwa marufuku mikusanyiko wa watu hadharani yalihusishwa na nambari chache ya vifo.

sourceString: Cities that implemented such interventions earlier had greater delays in reaching peak mortality rates.
targetString: Miji ambazo zimetekeleza mikakati kama haya mapema zilikuwa na kuchelewa sana kufikia viwango vya kilele cha mlipuko wa vifo.

sourceString: Schools closed for a median duration of 4 weeks according to a study of 43 US cities' response to the Spanish Flu.
targetString: Shule ambazo zilifungwa kwa muda wastani wa wiki 4 kulingana na uchunguzi ya mwitikio wa miji 43 Marekano kwa Homa ya mafua ya Uhispania.

sourceString: School closures were shown to reduce morbidity from the Asian flu by 90% during the 1957–58 outbreak, and up to 50% in controlling influenza in the US, 2004–2008.Multiple countries successfully slowed the spread of infection through school closures during the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule zilionyeshwa kupunguza kuwepo kwa ugonjwa kutoka homa ya mafua ya Asia kwa 90% katika mkurupuko wa 1957-58, na hadi 50% katika udhibiti wa homa ya mafua Marekani, 2004-2008. Nchi nyingi zimefanikiwa kupunguza kuenea kwa maambukizi kupitia shule kufungwa katika janga la Homa ya mafua ya H1N1 ya 2009.

sourceString: School closures in the city of Oita, Japan, were found to have successfully decreased the number of infected students at the peak of infection; however closing schools was not found to have significantly decreased the total number of infected students.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule katika mji wa Oita, Japan zilipatikana kufanikiwa kupunguza nambari ya wanafunzi walioambukizwa katika kilele cha maambukizi; hata hivyo kufungwa kwa shule ilipatikana kupunguza pakubwa nambari ya jumla ya wanafunzi walioambukizwa.

sourceString: Mandatory school closures and other social distancing measures were associated with a 29% to 37% reduction in influenza transmission rates.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule kwa lazima na hatua zingine za kutotangamana kwa watu zilihusishwa na upungufu wa 29% hadi 37% katika viwango vya uambukizaji wa homa ya mafua.

sourceString: Early school closures in the United States delayed the peak of the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa shule mapema Marekani ilichelewesha kilele cha janga la Homa ya mafua ya H1N1 ya 2009.

sourceString: Despite the overall success of closing schools, a study of school closures in Michigan found that "district level reactive school closures were ineffective."During the swine flu outbreak in 2009 in the UK, in an article titled "Closure of schools during an influenza pandemic" published in the Lancet Infectious Diseases, a group of epidemiologists endorsed the closure of schools in order to interrupt the course of the infection, slow further spread and buy time to research and produce a vaccine.
targetString: Licha ya mafanikio kwa ujumla ya kufungwa kwa shule, uchunguzi wa kufungwa kwa shule huko Michigan ilipata kuwa "kufungwa kwa shule katika kiwango cha wilaya hazikuwa na ufanisi."Katika mkurupuko wa homa ya mafua ya nguruwe mnamo 2009 huko UK, katika nakala iliyo na mada "Kufungwa kwa shule katika janga la homa ya mafua" iliyochapishwa katika Magonjwa ya Kuambukizwa ya Lancet, kikundi cha wanasayansi wanaochunguza magonjwa katika idadi ya watu waliidhinisha kufungwa kwa shule ili kukatiza mkondo wa maambukizi, kupunguza kuenea zaidi na kupata muda wa kufanya utafiti na kutengeneza chanjo.

sourceString: Having studied previous influenza pandemics including the 1918 flu pandemic, the influenza pandemic of 1957 and the 1968 flu pandemic, they reported on the economic and workforce effect school closure would have, particularly with a large percentage of doctors and nurses being women, of whom half had children under the age of 16.
targetString: Kwa kuchunguza janga la homa ya mafua ya hapo awali ikiwemo janga la homa ya mafua ya 1918, janga la homa ya mafua ya 1957 na janga la mafua ya 1968, waliripoti kuhusu athari ya kiuchumi na kikazi ambayo kufungwa kwa shule ingesababisha, hasa na asilimia kubwa ya madaktari na wauguzi kuwa wanawake, ambao nusu kati yao walikuwa na watoto chini ya miaka 16.

sourceString: They also looked at the dynamics of the spread of influenza in France during French school holidays and noted that cases of flu dropped when schools closed and re-emerged when they re-opened.
targetString: Walichunguza pia mienendo ya kusambazwa kwa homa ya mafua Ufaransa katika likizo ya shule ya Ufaransa na kusema kuwa visa vya homa ya mafua zilipunguwa wakati shule zilifungwa na kuzuka tena wakati walifungua tena.

sourceString: They noted that when teachers in Israel went on strike during the flu season of 1999–2000, visits to doctors and the number of respiratory infections dropped by more than a fifth and more than two fifths respectively.
targetString: Walisema kuwa wakati walimu huko Israeli walikuwa na mgomo wakati wa msimu wa homa ya mafua ya 1999-2000, kutembelea madaktari na nambari ya maambukizi ya kupumua ilipunguka kwa zaidi ya humusi na zaidi ya humusi mbili mtawalia.

sourceString: For schools and childcare facilities, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Kwa shule na vifaa vya kuwatunza watoto, Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa cha Marekani inapendekeza kufungwa kwa muda kupangusa au kusafisha kwa dawa ikiwa mtu aliyeambukizwa amekuwa katika jengo shuleni bila kuzingatia kuenea katika jamii.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as cancelling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Wakati kuna usambazaji wa kiwango cha chini hadi ya wastani katika jamii, mifumo ya kutotangamana kwa watu huweza kutekelezwa kama vile kukatiza safari za elimu shuleni, mikutano, na mikusanyiko mengine kubwa kama vile vipindi vya michezo au masomo ya kwaya au maakuli katika mikahawa, kuongeza nafasi kati ya madawati, kulegeza wakati wa kufika na kuondoka, kupunguza wageni wasihitajika, na kutumia eneo tofauti ya ofisi ya afya ya watoto walio na dalili kama ya homa ya mafua.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.
targetString: Wakati kuna usambazaji mkubwa katika jamii yao, pamoja na mikakati ya kutotangamana na watu, kufungwa kwa shule kwa muda mrefu huweza kuchukuliwa.

sourceString: On 26 January, China instituted measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak which included extending the Spring Festival holiday to contain the outbreak.
targetString: Tarehe 26 Januari, Uchina ilianzisha hatua za kudhibiti mkurupuko wa COVID-19 ambayo ilijumuisha kuongeza likizo ya Tamasha ya Masika kudhibiti mkurupuko.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country closed.
targetString: Vyuo vikuu na shule kote nchini zilifungwa.

sourceString: On 23 February, Iran's Ministry of Health announced the closure of universities, higher educational institutions and schools in several cities and provinces.
targetString: Tarehe 23 Februari, Wizara ya Afya ya Irani ilitangaza kufungwa kwa vyuo vikuu, taasisi za masomo ya juu na shule katika miji na mikoa kadhaa.

sourceString: On 3 March, UNESCO released the first global numbers on school closures and affected students.
targetString: Tarehe 3 Machi, UNESCO ilitoa nambari za kimataifa za kwanza kuhusu kufungwa kwa shule na wanafunzi walioathirika.

sourceString: It reported that 13 countries had enacted preventive measures including the temporary closure of schools and universities, impacting 290.5 million students around the world.
targetString: Iliripoti kuwa nchi 13 zilikuwa zimeweka hatua za kuzuia ugonjwa ikiwemo kufungwa kwa muda kwa shule na vyuo vikuu, iliyoathiri wanafunzi milioni 290.5 kote duniani.

sourceString: In reaction, UNESCO called on countries to support affected students and families and facilitate large-scale inclusive distance learning programmes.
targetString: kwa itikio, UNESCO ilihimiza nchi kusaidia wanafunzi walioathirika na familia na kuwezesha masomo inayojumuisha wote kupitia programu za kimtandao.

sourceString: On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Tarehe 4 Machi, serikali ya Italia iliagiza kufungwa kabisa kwa shule na vyuo vikuu vyote kote nchini wakati Italia ilirekodi vifo 100.

sourceString: In doing so, Italy became one of 22 countries on three continents which had announced or implemented school closures.
targetString: Kwa kufanya hivyo, Italia ilikuwa mojawapo wa nchi 22 katika bara tatu ambazo zilikuwa zimetekeleza kufungwa kwa shule.

sourceString: On 5 March, the majority of learners affected by COVID-19 emergency measures were located in China, with 233 million learners affected, followed by Japan at 16.5 million and Iran at 14.5 million.
targetString: Tarehe 5 Machi, wengi wa wanafunzi walioathirika na hatua za dharura ya COVID-19 walikuwa Uchina, na wanafunzi milioni 233 walioathirika, ikifuatwa na Japan na milioni 16.5 na Irani na milioni 14.5.

sourceString: By 10 March, one in five students worldwide was "staying away from school due to the COVID-19 crisis" while another one in four was barred from higher education institutions.
targetString: Kufikia 10 machi, moja kati ya wanafunzi watano ulimwenguni walikuwa "hawako shuleni kwa sababu ya hali ya hatari ya COVID-19" ilhali wengine moja kati ya wanne walizuiliwa katika taasisi za elimu ya ngazi ya juu.

sourceString: On 13 March, governments in 49 countries announced or implemented school closures, including 39 countries which closed schools nationwide and 22 countries with localised school closures.
targetString: Tarehe 13 Machi, serikali katika nchi 49 zilitangaza au kutekeleza kufungwa kwa shule, zikiwemo nchi 39 zilizofunga shule kote nchini na nchi 22 zilizofunga shule katika maeneo mengine.

sourceString: By 16 March, this figure increased from 49 to 73 countries according to UNESCO.
targetString: Kufikia 16 Machi, nambari hii iliongezeka kutoka nchi 49 hadi 73 kulingana na UNESCO.

sourceString: By 19 March, 50% of students worldwide were affected by school closures, corresponding to nationwide closures in 102 countries and local closures in 11 countries affecting 850 million children and youth.
targetString: Kufikia 19 Machi, 50% ya wanafunzi ulimwenguni waliathiriwa na kufungwa kwa shule, inayofanana na kufungwa kwa shule katika nchi 102 na kufungwa katika maeneo mengine katika nchi 11 na kuathiri watoto na vijana milioni 850.

sourceString: By 20 March, over 70% of the world's learners were impacted by closures, with 124 country-wide school closures.
targetString: Kufikia 20 Machi, zaidi ya 70% ya wanafunzi duniani waliathiriwa na kufungwa, na kufungwa kwa shule 124 kote nchini.

sourceString: On 23 March, all Nigerian school were found to have been closed down by Nigerian government, markets as well as companies were closed down and children were forbidden by parents to step out of their homes.
targetString: Tarehe 23 Machi, shule zote Nigeria zilikuwa zimefungwa na serikali ya Nigeria, masoko na kampuni vilevile zilifungwa na watoto walikatazwa na wazazi kutoka nje ya nyumba zao.

sourceString: On 26 March, all New Zealand schools and universities have been closed down across the country.
targetString: Tarehe 26 Machi, shule na vyuo vikuu zote New Zealand zimefungwa kote nchini.

sourceString: The government has imposed a two-week holiday, allowing schools to transition to forms of distant teaching as soon as possible.
targetString: Serikali imeagiza likizo ya wiki mbili, na kuruhusu shule kubadilisha jinsi ya kufunza hadi kufunza mtandaoni haraka iwezekanavyo.

sourceString: Universities have closed for one week, but resumed with online teaching afterwards.
targetString: Vyuo vikuu vimefungwa kwa wiki moja, lakini ikaendelea na masomo mtandaoni baadaye.

sourceString: Other school services remain open, but teaching is restricted to distant learning.
targetString: Huduma zingine za shule zitafunguliwa, lakini mafunzo imewekewa vikwazo na kufanywa kupitia njia za kimtandao.

sourceString: By 27 March, nearly 90 percent of the world's student population was out of class.
targetString: By 27 March, nearly 90 percent of the world's student population was out of class.

sourceString: Regions with schools remaining open included Taiwan, Singapore, Australia, Sweden, and some U.S. states.
targetString: Regions with schools remaining open included Taiwan, Singapore, Australia, Sweden, and some U.S. states.

sourceString: By 29 March, more than 1.5 billion children and other students were affected by nationwide school closures.
targetString: By 29 March, more than 1.5 billion children and other students were affected by nationwide school closures.

sourceString: Others were disrupted by localized closures.
targetString: Others were disrupted by localized closures.

sourceString: Until April 6, holidays were extended in all secondary schools of Turkmenistan.
targetString: Until April 6, holidays were extended in all secondary schools of Turkmenistan.

sourceString: An order signed by the Ministry of Education as a preventative measure aims to prevent the spread of respiratory diseases in connection with the WHO coronavirus pandemic.
targetString: An order signed by the Ministry of Education as a preventative measure aims to prevent the spread of respiratory diseases in connection with the WHO coronavirus pandemic.

sourceString: 10 countries have localised schools closures, UNESCO estimates  473,933,356  learners are potentially at risk (pre-primary to upper-secondary education) and 77,938,904 learners are potentially at risk in tertiary education.
targetString: 10 countries have localised schools closures, UNESCO estimates  473,933,356  learners are potentially at risk (pre-primary to upper-secondary education) and 77,938,904 learners are potentially at risk in tertiary education.

sourceString: Note: Figures correspond to total number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8] who could be affected should localised closures become countrywide.
targetString: Note: Figures correspond to total number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8] who could be affected should localised closures become countrywide.

sourceString: Enrolment figures based on latest UNESCO Institute of Statistics data.
targetString: Enrolment figures based on latest UNESCO Institute of Statistics data.

sourceString: School closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have shed a light on numerous issues affecting access to education, as well as broader socio-economic issues.
targetString: School closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have shed a light on numerous issues affecting access to education, as well as broader socio-economic issues.

sourceString: As of March 12, more than 370 million children and youth are not attending school because of temporary or indefinite country wide school closures mandated by governments in an attempt to slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: As of March 12, more than 370 million children and youth are not attending school because of temporary or indefinite country wide school closures mandated by governments in an attempt to slow the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: As of 29 March, nearly 90% of the world's learners were impacted by closures.Even when school closures are temporary, it carries high social and economic costs.
targetString: As of 29 March, nearly 90% of the world's learners were impacted by closures.Even when school closures are temporary, it carries high social and economic costs.

sourceString: The disruptions they cause affect people across communities, but their impact is more severe for disadvantaged children and their families including interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems and consequent economic cost to families who cannot work.
targetString: The disruptions they cause affect people across communities, but their impact is more severe for disadvantaged children and their families including interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems and consequent economic cost to families who cannot work.

sourceString: Working parents are more likely to miss work when schools close in order to take care of their children, incurring wage loss in many instances and negatively impacting productivity.
targetString: Working parents are more likely to miss work when schools close in order to take care of their children, incurring wage loss in many instances and negatively impacting productivity.

sourceString: Localised school closures place burdens on schools as parents and officials redirect children to schools that are open.
targetString: Localised school closures place burdens on schools as parents and officials redirect children to schools that are open.

sourceString: Women often represent a large share of health-care workers and often cannot attend work because of childcare obligations that result from school closures.
targetString: Women often represent a large share of health-care workers and often cannot attend work because of childcare obligations that result from school closures.

sourceString: This means that many medical professionals are not at the facilities where they are most needed during a health crisis.
targetString: This means that many medical professionals are not at the facilities where they are most needed during a health crisis.

sourceString: Lack of access to technology or fast, reliable internet access can prevent students in rural areas and from disadvantaged families.
targetString: Lack of access to technology or fast, reliable internet access can prevent students in rural areas and from disadvantaged families.

sourceString: Lack of access to technology or good internet connectivity is an obstacle to continued learning, especially for students from disadvantaged families.
targetString: Lack of access to technology or good internet connectivity is an obstacle to continued learning, especially for students from disadvantaged families.

sourceString: In response to school closures caused by COVID-19, UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.To aid in slowing the transmission of COVID-19, hundreds of libraries have temporarily closed.
targetString: In response to school closures caused by COVID-19, UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.To aid in slowing the transmission of COVID-19, hundreds of libraries have temporarily closed.

sourceString: In the United States, numerous major cities announced public library closures, including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, and New York City, affecting 221 libraries.
targetString: In the United States, numerous major cities announced public library closures, including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, and New York City, affecting 221 libraries.

sourceString: For students without internet at home, this increases the difficulty of keeping up with distance learning.
targetString: For students without internet at home, this increases the difficulty of keeping up with distance learning.

sourceString: School closures puts a strain on parents and guardians to provide childcare and manage distance learning while children are out of school.
targetString: School closures puts a strain on parents and guardians to provide childcare and manage distance learning while children are out of school.

sourceString: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.
targetString: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.

sourceString: Many children worldwide rely on free or discounted meals at schools.
targetString: Many children worldwide rely on free or discounted meals at schools.

sourceString: When schools close, nutrition is compromised.Nutrition plays a critical role in cognitive development and academic performance for children.In Washington State, around 45% of the states 1.1 million students enrolled in traditional public and charter schools qualify for subsidised school meals.
targetString: When schools close, nutrition is compromised.Nutrition plays a critical role in cognitive development and academic performance for children.In Washington State, around 45% of the states 1.1 million students enrolled in traditional public and charter schools qualify for subsidised school meals.
